TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {28115=Horseman Club to host euchre games TELL CITY – The Southern Indiana Horseman Club will host its last euchre game event of the year Dec. 3. Chili, hot dogs, desserts, soft drinks and coffee will be available at 6 p.m. with games at 7. Rules will be announced before games. For more information, call 836-2127 or 836-2052., 30082=Democrats to gather for party Dec. 3 TELL CITY – The Perry County Democrats will meet for their annual Christmas party Dec. 3 at the Democrat Headquarters, 12th and Rubens streets in Tell City. Cost is $5 per person. Social hour will start at 5 p.m. and dinner will be served at 6. RVSPs are required by Friday and can be made by calling Dale Groves at 547-2890., 29239=EUCC to offer salad luncheon Dec. 1 TELL CITY – The Evangelical United Church of Christ Women’s Guild will sponsor a Christmas salad luncheon from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. Dec. 1 at the church. Admission is $8 at the door. The community is invited to attend. Carryouts will be available., 30891=VNA Plus blood-pressure, blood-sugar screenings TELL CITY – The Visiting Nurse Association Plus will no longer offer free blood-pressure and blood-sugar screenings at Wal-Mart in Tell City. Screenings at Twilight Towers will continue, however, there is no scheduled screening time in November due to the Thanksgiving holiday. For more information, call VNA at 547-7967., 39581=Copyright © 2015, 27654=Golden Living-Lincoln Hills bazaar TELL CITY– The Golden Living Center-Lincoln Hills resident council will hold its annual Christmas bazaar from 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. Dec. 2 in the main hallway of the nursing home. Candy, baked items, crafts, new and gently used items and much more will be for sale. All proceeds will go to the Golden Living Center-Lincoln Hills resident council. The public is invited to attend., 29571=PC Republicans Christmas party set TELL CITY – The Perry County Republicans will host a Christmas party Dec. 3 at Tell City American Legion. Doors will open at 6 p.m. with a dinner catered by Bill and Dave’s Smokin’ Pit to start at 6:45 p.m. Cost of the meal will be $12 per person and children 14 years and younger will eat for free. There will also be a cash bar. Entertainment will be provided by SweetWater and Santa might make a special appearance., 30496=Conservation Club to meet Dec. 5 LEOPOLD – The Leopold Conservation Club will meet at 7 p.m. Dec. 5 at the clubhouse. Members are encouraged to attend. To become a member, call Susie James at 843-5974. The meeting is held the first Monday of every month, unless a holiday falls on the date. In that case, the meeting is held the first Tuesday., 28781=Red Cross to offer public class Dec. 1 TELL CITY – The American Red Cross will conduct a professional rescuer and health-care providers class from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Dec. 1 at Fifth Third Bank Community Room. To register for the class, call (877) 519-5967or visit www.redcross.org and click on “Take a class.” For more information, call 843-4747., 28481=German American selling candles for Relay TELL CITY – The three locations of German American in Tell City are selling a selection of candles for Relay for Life. The candles cost $7 each. Proceeds will benefit the 2012 German American Relay for Life team., 27259=The Perry County News is pleased to announce events of local interest as a service to our readers and the community. Information should be sent to The News at P.O. Box 309, Tell City, IN 47586. Information can also be faxed to 547-2847 or e-mailed to lifestyles@perrycountynews.com. Please include a telephone number.}
